wikipedia_page.main: Arun Arora (born 10 October 1971) is a British Anglican priest and solicitor. He has been Vicar of St Nicholas' Church, Durham since 2017. From 2012 to 2017, he served as Director of Communications of the Archbishops' Council of the Church of England.

link_mentions.page: King Edward VI Five Ways School
response: * Arun Arora - Anglican priest and former Director of Communications of the Church of England
* Arun Arora became vicar in 2017, having previously been Director of Communications for the Church of England since 2012.
* Arun Arora (born 1971), British Anglican priest and former Director of Communications of the Church of England

The term young professional generally refers to young people between 20 and 30 who are employed in a profession or white-collar occupation.  The meaning may be ambiguous"I am not sure what "young professionals" means..." After the storm: American society a decade after the Vietnam War : proceedings of the International Conference on "The U.S.A.: A Decade After the Vietnam War", 1987, p. 33 and has evolved from its original narrow meaning of a young person in a professional field.Arun Arora and Andrew Francis, The rule of lawyers in Modernising Britain, Fabian Discussion Papers, iss. 42, 1998, p. 4 Although derivative of the term 'yuppie', it has grown into its own set of meanings.
* Arun Arora, former Director of Communications of the Church of England, served his curacy here.
